title: Is it bad that I've never had a "real job" at 19?
body:
I don't like the concept of work. It's miserable. I've been a long time lurker here, and I love the sub! :)
But anyways.. anyone find it bad I've never had a "real" job. I've done volunteering here and there, and gig work, but nothing that would be considered traditional 9-5.
Looking forward to your responses! :)
-M.
author: [deleted]

title: Contra Musk: There are Other Futures Besides a UBI
author: AbolishWork

title: For A Society Without Jobs
body:
James Livingston (in his new book, "No More Work")  directly confronts the issue of socially necessary work with what he calls socially beneficial work, a somewhat slippery concept The former faces the same forces of routinization, speed-up and, finally, elimination like many jobs, whereas the latter retains its desirability – as meaningful work – even though it is often valueless as a source of compensation.

For a critical, sympathetic, review of Livingston's book [see here.](http://dissidentvoice.org/2017/02/for-a-society-without-jobs/)
author: axelztangi

title: Preoccupation w/Occupation [webcomic]
body:
Men was always embarrassed when the
more advanced lifeforms would catch him

doing something primitive like having a job.
